answer: The discovery of non-thermal emission in dust-enshrouded Wolf-Rayet stars extends our understanding of dust production and motivates a re-evaluation of single-star and binary stellar evolution models (astro-ph/0103184).
explanation: This paper discusses the discovery of non-thermal emission in dust-enshrouded Wolf-Rayet stars and its implications for dust production and stellar evolution models.
evidence_quote: non-thermal emission, which is usually attributed to colliding winds
